required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Effect of FX006 on Synovial Inflammation in Patients With OA of the Knee
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Effect of the Administration of FX006 on Synovial Inflammation in Patients With Osteoarthritis of the Knee

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label study assessing the effect of the administration of a single intra-articular (IA) injection of FX006 32 mg on synovial volume in patients with osteoarthritis (OA) of the knee.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is an open-label study assessing the effect of the administration of a single intra-articular (IA) injection of FX006 32 mg on synovial volume in patients with osteoarthritis (OA) of the knee. The study will be conducted in male and female patients who are ≥ 40 years of age.
Eligible patients who provide written consent and meet all entry criteria will undergo initial ultrasound examination and MRI with contrast of the index knee, and then receive a single IA injection of FX006 administered to the index knee at Baseline/Day 1. Patients will return to the clinic at Weeks 6 and 24 for an MRI with contrast of the index knee and other assessments. Patients must also have a blood sample drawn for Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) testing within 30 days prior to the scheduled MRIs. In addition, a patient questionnaire will be administered and adverse events (AEs) and concomitant medication updates will be collected via telephone at Weeks 12 and 18.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Standardized Change in Synovial Volume (SV) at 6 Weeks
primary_outcome.description: Synovial volume (mm^3) as measured by MRI and read by a central imaging vendor. Standardization was performed by dividing the model-derived least squares means and corresponding confidence intervals by the adjusted standard deviation (SD). Therefore, the mean standardized change represents the change in synovial volume expressed in standard deviation units.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Absolute Change in Synovial Volume at 6 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Mean absolute change from baseline at 6 weeks in synovial volume (mm^3) as measured by MRI and read by a central imaging vendor. The least squares mean changes are estimated using a mixed effects model for repeated measures with fixed effects for study time point, study site, baseline score and baseline femur bone volume (mm^3) and a random effect for patient.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Standardized Change in Synovial Volume (SV) at 24 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Synovial volume (mm^3) as measured by MRI and read by a central imaging vendor. Standardization was performed by dividing the model-derived least squares means and corresponding confidence intervals by the adjusted standard deviation (SD). Therefore, the mean standardized change represents the change in synovial volume expressed in standard deviation units.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Absolute Change in Synovial Volume at 24 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Mean absolute change (mm^3) from baseline at 24 weeks in synovial volume (mm^3) as measured by MRI and read by a central imaging vendor. The least squares mean changes are estimated using a mixed effects model for repeated measures with fixed effects for study time point, study site, baseline score and baseline femur bone volume (mm^3) and a random effect for patient.

arm_group.description: Single intra-articular (IA) injection of FX006 32 mg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written consent to participate in the study
- Male or female ≥ 40 years of age
- Body mass index (BMI) ≤ 40 kg/m^2
- Ambulatory and in good general health
- Willing and able to comply with the study procedures and visit schedules and able to follow verbal and written instructions
- Willing to abstain from use of protocol-restricted medications during the study
- Symptoms associated with OA of the index knee for ≥ 6 months prior to Screening (patient self-report is acceptable)
- Currently meets American College of Rheumatology (ACR) Criteria (clinical and radiological) for OA
- Kellgren-Lawrence (K-L) Grade 2 or 3 in the index knee based on X-ray performed during Screening (centrally read)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any inflammatory arthritis including reactive arthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, arthritis associated with inflammatory bowel disease, gout or secondary OA from gout
- History of infection or crystal disease in the index knee joint
- Unstable index knee joint (such as a torn anterior cruciate ligament) within 12 months of Screening
- Surgery or arthroscopy of the index knee within 12 months of Screening
- IA corticosteroid (investigational or marketed) in any joint within 3 months of Screening
- IA treatment of the index knee with hyaluronic acid (investigational or marketed) within 6 months of Screening
- IV or IM corticosteroids (investigational or marketed) within 3 months of Screening
- Oral corticosteroids (investigational or marketed) within 1 month of Screening
- Any other IA drug/biologic in the index knee within 6 months of Screening or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer) (e.g., platelet rich plasma (PRP) injection, stem cells, prolotherapy and amniotic fluid injection)
- Prior administration of FX006
- eGFR results <40 mL/minute
- Any contraindication to MRI Scanning (e.g., presence of certain ferromagnetic foreign bodies or electronic devices including most cardiac pacemakers, claustrophobia)
- Known hypersensitivity to any form of radiographic contrast
- Females who are pregnant or nursing or plan to become pregnant during the study; men who plan to conceive during the study

group.title: FX006 32mg
group.description: All patients who received any amount of FX006 32mg

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Needle inserted but no drug administered

baseline.population: All patients who received any amount of FX006 32mg

group.description: All patients who received any amount of FX006 32mg

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Mean Standardized Change in Synovial Volume (SV) at 6 Weeks
outcome.description: Synovial volume (mm^3) as measured by MRI and read by a central imaging vendor. Standardization was performed by dividing the model-derived least squares means and corresponding confidence intervals by the adjusted standard deviation (SD). Therefore, the mean standardized change represents the change in synovial volume expressed in standard deviation units.
outcome.population: Participants with pre-treatment synovial volume measurement as determined by quantitative image analysis, as well as a quality Week 6 MRI who received a single intra-articular (IA) injection of FX006 32 mg

group.title: Total Population
group.description: All patients who received a single intra-articular (IA) injection of FX006 32mg and had a pre-treatment synovial volume measurement

group.title: Patients With Baseline Synovitis
group.description: The subset of the Total Population who had a pre-treatment synovial volume measurement of greater than 3000 mm^3 of gadolinium enhancement as determined by quantitative image analysis

reported_events.time_frame: Through study completion; up to 28 weeks

group.title: Total Population
group.description: All patients who received an attempted single intra-articular (IA) injection of FX006 32 mg

group.title: Patients With Baseline Synovitis

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: One patient experienced procedural anxiety during the placement of the syringe on the inserted needle and did not receive the full dose of FX006. This patient is still counted in the safety population.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Dr. Scott Kelley, Chief Medical Officer
